title: How to Make Chocolate Covered S'mores

steps.headline: Before you start, make sure that were you are working is clean and clutter free as you will need counter space.
To prep, place a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper under your cooling rack.
steps.description: Lay your graham crackers and chocolate out so that it’s easier to place the marshmallow on it later.

steps.headline: To start, turn your oven on to a low flame.
Next, hold your skewer with the marshmallow over the flame, slowly turning it to roast it evenly.
After the marshmallow is a light gold, place it on the half of the gram cracker that has the chocolate on it and fold the other half of the graham cracker over the marshmallow.
Place the s'more on the cooling rack and lay a heavy plate over it to keep it from rising.
steps.description: While it is cooling, fill the large pot with water and place it on the stove with a medium-high flame.

steps.headline: Once the water comes to a boil, carefully place the second small pot filled with the melting chocolate in the water.
steps.description: Caution, place the pot carefully as if the water spills over it will burn. Continually mix the chocolate so that it does not burn.

steps.headline: Once the chocolate is smooth, take it off the heat and bring the pot over to the s'more.
Remove the plate from the s'more and slowly pour the chocolate over it.
steps.description: The s'more should be flat as the plate was weighing it down. Make sure to pour the chocolate in the center of the s'more to spread it evenly. The extra chocolate that drips off will go onto the parchment papered cookie sheet.

steps.headline: Repeat for as many s'mores at you need.
steps.description: If you are making a group of s'mores, it will be easier to make them all first then melt the chocolate to pore over. Leave the s'mores on the cooling rack until the chocolate has hardened.

text: Before you start, make sure that were you are working is clean and clutter free as you will need counter space.  To prep, place a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper under your cooling rack. Lay your graham crackers and chocolate out so that it’s easier to place the marshmallow on it later. To start, turn your oven on to a low flame.  Next, hold your skewer with the marshmallow over the flame, slowly turning it to roast it evenly.  After the marshmallow is a light gold, place it on the half of the gram cracker that has the chocolate on it and fold the other half of the graham cracker over the marshmallow.  Place the s'more on the cooling rack and lay a heavy plate over it to keep it from rising. While it is cooling, fill the large pot with water and place it on the stove with a medium-high flame. Once the water comes to a boil, carefully place the second small pot filled with the melting chocolate in the water. Caution, place the pot carefully as if the water spills over it will burn. Continually mix the chocolate so that it does not burn. Once the chocolate is smooth, take it off the heat and bring the pot over to the s'more.  Remove the plate from the s'more and slowly pour the chocolate over it. The s'more should be flat as the plate was weighing it down. Make sure to pour the chocolate in the center of the s'more to spread it evenly. The extra chocolate that drips off will go onto the parchment papered cookie sheet. Repeat for as many s'mores at you need. If you are making a group of s'mores, it will be easier to make them all first then melt the chocolate to pore over. Leave the s'mores on the cooling rack until the chocolate has hardened. Finished.
